course.subject: SOSC
course.name: Health Psychology
course.description: Health psychology is the scientific study of how biological, psychological, and social factors affect health promotion as well as the prevention and treatment of illness. We look at how people stay healthy, why they become ill, and how they cope and recover when they are ill. This course is intended to introduce students to the theoretical models, research methodology, empirical findings, and current issues in health psychology. Students should complete the course with a fundamental knowledge in this young and exciting field of study.
course.prerequisites: SOSC 1960 OR SOSC 1980

reviews.author: Bone
reviews.comment_content:
This course is about how biopsychosocial factors interact with each other and affect health promotion, prevention and treatment of illness.

- Introduction to Health Psychology
- Health Promotion/ Prevention
- Health Behavior Change
- Stress
- Coping
- Using Health Services
- Patient-Provider Relations
- Management of Pain
- Management of Chronic Illnesses, including
1. Circulation-related diseases
2. Immunity-related diseases
3. Emotional responses and coping
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Annie Shu is new to UST. Her teaching was ok but the concepts in the PowerPoint slides were a bit disorganized. I would recommend you to refer to the textbook instead. But she is very nice and is very willing to answer student's questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is quite nice.

- Class Participation 10%
(fill in the Qualtrics link at the end of each class)
- Final Quiz 30%
(Make sure you go through the textbook, it's better to follow the textbook rather than prof's ppt)
- Group Project 30%
(Outline 5%, Presentation 15%, Presentation Participation 10%)
- Individual Paper 30%

My score:
Class Participation 10/10 (Mean: 9.05)
Final Quiz 24/30 (Mean: 22.49)
Group Project
- Outline 5/5 (Mean: 4.63)
- Presentation 14.5/15 (Mean: 13.09)
- Presentation Participation 10/10 (Mean: 9.79)
Individual Paper 25/30 (Mean: 24.53)
Total: 88.5 (A-)
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is acceptable for a 3000-level course.

Besides on answering 1 simple question in the Qualtrics link at the end of each class, there is only 1 quiz (in MC format), 1 group project presentation and 1 individual paper to hand in.

For the group project, you just have to design a health promotion/ prevention program of one health-related behavior to the public. You can decide the topic and the target group yourself.

For the individual paper, you have to write a reflection in 1000 words on 1 news article about any health issues and explain how it is related to health psychology.

reviews.comment_workload:
As a business student, I think it is surprisingly easy for a 3000-level course.
Parti: 1-2 short questions.
Final quiz: Open books, 50 mins for 40 MC
Group project: Have guidelines, outlines and participation for you to grab grade (if you miss participation - which just give feedback on others' present; that's must be your issue 0..0 )
Individual paper: this one is ok, but there is an upper word limit of 1000 words, so you need not to be worrying about the need to review thousands of pieces of literature...

Best 3000-level psychology courses that I have encountered, merely no workload except the necessary one.
